answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Jay,
There are several examples in Colorado of urban renewal authorities being established under state law.     
The City of Fountain established an Urban Renewal Authority in 2007 with the help of Leland Consulting Group.  http://www.ci.fountain.co.us/department/?fDD=23-0 
Golden, Colorado created the Golden Urban Renewal Authority (GURA) in 1989. http://www.gura.com/about.htm
La Junta Urban Renewal Authority started in 1966.  http://www.ci.la-junta.co.us/urbanrenewal/urbanrenewalindex.html
The Loveland Urban Renewal Authority (LURA) was established by the city council in 2002. http://www.ci.loveland.co.us/lrplanning/Urban%20Renewal/urban_renewal%20Loveland%20LRP.htm
Arvada Urban Renewal Authority (AURA).  http://arvada.org/about-arvada/arvada-urban-renewal-authority-aura/
Urban Renewal Authority Longmont established in 2005. http://www.ci.longmont.co.us/com_dev/urbanrenewal.htm
The Urban Renewal Authority of Pueblo (URAP). http://www.pueblourbanrenewal.org/
You may want to follow up directly with the respective cities to gain more information.  
I hope that is helpful,
Pooja Varma 
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

text:

Jay
